text: Edmund C. Dyas (November 11, 1939 â€“ January 23, 2011) was an American football player. He played college football from 1958 to 1960 for the Auburn Tigers. He finished fourth for the Heisman Trophy in his senior season. Dyas was elected to the College Football Hall of Fame in 2009. Dyas became an orthopedic surgeon in Mobile, Alabama after his college football career. He died from stomach cancer on January 23, 2011 at the age of 71. ==Other websites== * NFF profile * Dr. Ed Dyas Elected To College Football Hall of Fame * Notice of Dyas' death Category:1939 births Category:2011 deaths Category:American football running backs Category:Deaths from stomach cancer
title: Ed Dyas
